Articles.Content:
Is it possible to move fuel from two landed ship without docking?

I'm considering landing some tank probe on a site and use its fuel for another ship. I see there are small tanks (still not available from my research level) and I wonder if they are suitable to deliver fuel. Still I don't understand how to move fuel without docking.

Alternatively I should dock landed vessels but depending on their shape can be pretty difficult (or also impossible)
Not in the stock game. There are mods that will let you do it. I'm not sure what they are, but if you wait a little bit someone will post links to them.

If mods are an option, EVA Transfer is my suggestion. It allows just that and do it very well. 

. Another popular choice is Simple Logistics

You always have the claw, its tend to be easier than docking as you only need to get an clean contact. 

You also have KAS https://spacedock.info/mod/1987/Kerbal Attachment System (KAS)

It let you get two ships 30 meter distance, eva and grab an hose, then move kerbal to an connector on other ship. 30 meter is max hose length. 
An enginer with an tool can even add an connector or parts so you can get fuel or other resources. 
It works even better for ground bases. Hint don't put the base models on landing legs, just use grinders as landing legs will contract then mining and some modules get heavier than others and then you time warp the base will jump on an low gravity world. 

Edited June 11, 2020 by magnemoe
Thankyou all. I'll give a try to KAS and see how's going!
